title: cmd/go: go install should remove binary generated by go build
body: In a command directory mycmd, go build writes a binary called ./mycmd. go install writes $GOPATH/bin/mycmd. When you run mycmd after that, you're likely to get the stale binary from the last go build, assuming . is in your path. At the point where go install runs, the previously built binary is by definition stale. go install should probably remove ./mycmd, as if it also did go clean.
